# Project Euler 52: Permuted Multiples - C# Console Application

This workspace contains a C# console application that solves Project Euler problem 52.

## Project Setup Completed

- [x] Verify that the copilot-instructions.md file in the .github directory is created.
- [x] Clarify Project Requirements - C# console project for Project Euler problem 52
- [x] Scaffold the Project - Created using `dotnet new console`
- [x] Customize the Project - Added Project Euler 52 solution code
- [x] Install Required Extensions - No additional extensions required
- [x] Compile the Project - Successfully builds with `dotnet build`
- [x] Create and Run Task - VS Code tasks created for build and run
- [x] Launch the Project - Debug configuration created in launch.json
- [x] Ensure Documentation is Complete - README.md created with full documentation

## Project Features

- Solves Project Euler problem 52: Finding the smallest positive integer x such that 2x, 3x, 4x, 5x, and 6x contain the same digits
- Answer: 142857
- Includes verification output showing all multiples have the same digit permutations
- VS Code tasks for building and running
- Debug configuration for stepping through code
- Comprehensive README with problem description, solution explanation, and usage instructions

## Development Instructions

Use `dotnet build` to compile and `dotnet run` to execute the solution.
The project is ready for debugging with F5 or using VS Code's Run and Debug panel.
